hints.content:
To find the number of liters in the pool now, we add the number of liters yesterday $(\blueD{425} \text { L})$ and the number of liters from the hose $(\purpleD{23} \text { L})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total volume. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 425 liters. The shorter right part is labeled 23 liters. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Liters yesterday. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Liters from hose. !

hints.content: There are $\greenD{448}\text { L}$ of water in the baby pool now.

question.content:
Kathiva has a baby pool in her backyard.  Yesterday, the pool had $425$ liters of water in it.  This afternoon, Kathiva used a hose to add $23$ more liters of water.  

**How many liters of water are in the baby pool now?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] liters
